required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Internet-based Parent Training for Parents of Children With Externalising Behavior Problems
clinical_study.official_title: Internet-based Parent Training for Parents of Children With Externalising Behavior Problems: A Randomised Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to evaluate the efficacy of a 5-week, therapist-guided, internet-delivered parent management training program (BIP SAMBA) targeting children aged 5 - 11 years with externalising behavior problems. The study is a randomised controlled trial with parents of N=30 children participating. The intervention BIP SAMBA is compared with a waitlist control condition. Participants in the control condition will be crossed over to the active treatment after 5 weeks. The primary outcome measure is the Eyberg Child Behavior Inventory (ECBI) at the post treatment (5 weeks after baseline assessment).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in conduct problems from baseline (week 0) to post-treatment (week 6)
primary_outcome.description: Measures externalising behavior problems in children; Min: 0 Max 216; A higher score indicates worse conduct problems.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in mental health issues from baseline (week 0) to post-treatment (week 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures conduct problems, emotional problems, ADHD symptoms, peer problems and prosocial behaviours; Min: 0 Max: 40p; A higher score indicate worse mental health problems Screens for behavioral problems, emotional problems, ADHD symptoms, peer problems and pro social behaviours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change in parenting strategies from baseline (week 0) to post-treatment (week 6)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures parenting strategies; Min: 0 Max: 76; A higher score indicates worse parenting strategies
Measures satisfaction with a treatment that has been received; Min: 0 Max: 24; A higher score indicates better satisfaction with the treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly questions about frequency of and impairment from behavior problems
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Changes in behavior problems from baseline to week 5
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rate these two questions every week throughout the treatment; Min 0 Max: 9; A higher score indicates worse behavior problems

arm_group.description: Five weeks of therapist-guided online delivered parents training

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being parent of a child between 5 and 11 years
- This child has externalising behavior problems
- The parent has access to the internet
- The parent speaks and write Swedish
Exclusion Criteria:
- The child has an autism diagnosis
- The child has severe conduct problems
- There is domestic violence occurring within the family
- There alcohol or substance abuse occurring within the family
